name: Hell On Wheels
description:
Controls: 
- WASD to Move
- TAB to toggle map

Gameplay:
Navigate around the UT campus and pick up soul packages at the Tower, Hospital, and Cemetery. (Nothing actually happens when you pick up a package)

“Welcome new recruit. We are excited to see you so eager to start your job. Just a few things before you start. We care about our consumers, so for their safety, it’s imperative that we maintain their confidentiality no matter what. Now that that’s out of the way, time is of the essence quite literally I’m afraid... If we don’t collect all the packages within a certain time, well...lets just say there will be hell to pay. Now then, just one more thing before I let you go. As the company CEO, I take pride in the quality of my business and, by extension, the quality of your work. To ensure your driving meets my standards, your vehicle will be monitored at all times. You understand I’m sure. Good luck and go raise some hell out there kid.”

Funeral Home Director

"A guy we recently put in the ground had a package addressed to a 'Lou Cipher'. Know anybody with that name? Anyways, take this package off my hands - it reeks of death."

Nurse

"It’s a real shame, there’s been a lot of people dying recently… Our last patient asked me to send out this package for him. It gives me the creeps though so would you mind delivering it for me?"

*Phone rings, a call from Lou Cipher*

"This is the place. Deceased person internment center. The package is nearby… I can tell."

Created By:

Alexander Davis: Code and Narrative

Melody Geiger: 3D Assets, 2D Portraits, and Narrative

Remus Wong: Technical Art and Level Design

Music: "Sims Soundtrack" written by Jerry Martin and Marc Russo
